fields.description:
Just feels broken when the only way you can interact with the date field is to click the date picker icon (which you also can't tab to in order to interact with).

You should _definitely_ be able to tab into these fields, which could open the date picker.

fields.description:
As a greenhopper administrator I would like to be able to configure which fields are displayed on the cards on the kanban rapid board, so that relevant information is visible without clicking on the tasks. 

Specifically I would like to see the time tracking fields (original estimate, remaining estimate, etc). These are also impossible to add to the detail view on the rapid board. I would like to be able to add them there as well.
fields.summary: As a greenhopper administrator I'd like to configure the fields displayed on the cards in the kanban rapid board

I'm not actually sure why one gets a drop area hint but the other one doesn't - it makes no sense at all.

User who does not have permission to edit versions can change start date and "appear" to change the rest

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8401].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a non administrator user attempts to display sprints using the {{openSprints()}} JQL, they display the error as per the attached screenshot.

h3. Environment

* JIRA 5.2.10
* OS X 10.7.5
* PostgreSQL 9.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new sprint.
# Add issues to it.
# Delete those issues.
# Attempt to view the sprint using a user that does not have the *Administrator* [Global Permission|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions], for example:
{noformat}
project = JRA and Sprint in opensprints()
{noformat}
(i) This can be reproduced here with [https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20JRA%20and%20Sprint%20in%20opensprints()]

h3. Expected Results

There is no error presented to the user.

h3. Actual Results

The user will receive the error as per the attached screenshot and below:
{quote}
Sprint with id 104 does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.

{quote}

h3. Notes

Similar to GHS-7659.
fields.summary: openSprints() JQL returns error if no open sprints exist

fields.description:
Board TZ - Sydney
User TZ - Sydney
fields.summary: GMT offset is incorrect for Sydney time zone

fields.description:
User TZ is GMT+10
Board TZ is GMT+10
JVM TZ is GMT+10

All timezones are aligned. Yet release date is shown 10 hours ahead of where it should be.
fields.summary: Release Date is being shown at the wrong time on the chart

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Board has working days Mon-Fri
# Today is Friday
# Create sample scrum board
# Version 3.0 has 2 issues, both 5 points. Mark one of them as done.
# View the Version Report.

Adding Saturday as a working day makes the prediction happen correctly.

Debugging through the code, it seems that the "estimate per day" is calculated as 0.
fields.summary: Version prediction is not shown for sample data

fields.description:
STR:

1.Run http://evbyminsd2236:8080/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1 (CDP workshop request)
2.Select any column containing two or more CDP requests, for example, ‘To be accepted’
3.Click any CDP link which is located on top, for example, CDP-37 => corresponding request is opened at the right-side part
4.Go to Settings->Send to Top

AR: “Issue has been re-ranked to the top of its column” while other issue is highlighted and opened at the right-side part of the screen (see '1.jpg')
ER:There should not be discrepancies between message and highlighted issue
fields.summary: Discrepancies between message shown and highlighted issue

fields.description:
Currently with a large backlog and with a high issue creation rate it can become tedious and difficult to remember where I left off in my backlog.

Maybe this could be some sort of marker or indicator that I and other admins can move.

fields.description:
For example, I have project A and B. 

If I create a board that covers project A, I get all epics and versions for project A but none from project B. This is good.

If I create a board that covers project B, I get all epics and versions for project B but none from project A. This is good.

If I create a board that covers projects A and B, I get all epics for projects A and B but no versions whatsoever. This is bad.

I would expect versions to work the same way as epics and have all my versions displayed in a board that covers projects A and B.
fields.summary: In multiproject boards, versions do not appear (though epics do)

fields.description: As a person who creates agile boards, I want a way to provide a description on the board to other viewers so they know what my intended purpose for the board is and they have access to any information I feel is relevant for them with regard to the board.
fields.summary: Description field for Agile Boards

fields.description: Currently, comments are displayed in descending order when viewing an issue in Detail View. Despite being able to re-order comments directly on the issue, it would be a good improvement to have them sortable in GH Detail View as well.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to sort comments in ascending order when viewing an issue in Detail View

fields.description:
The agile burndown chart uses the issue's Remaining hours field even if the issue is resolved. This makes little sense--if the issue is resolved, then by definition it has 0 remaining time.

This is a big annoyance: the chart becomes wildly inaccurate if we use less or more time than estimated to satisfy issues. This makes a mess of time reporting and is a pointless step since, again, a resolved issue has no remaining work. Otherwise, it shouldn't be resolved.

Further, what if we need to reopen the issue? It would be nice to keep burning against its remaining time instead of having to totally re-estimate because we had to manually force it to 0 time before closing it.

Here's a use case:

Time estimate: 4 hours
User resolves issue: 2.5 hours
Time remaining: 1.5 hours
Issue is re-opened for incomplete fix, and user logs another hour on the same issue. If this works properly, then the report just works.

If we adjust the time remaining either manually or with a post action, then it will have have scope adjustments at Resolve, and then scope adjustments at Reopen and then scope adjustments at Resolved again. We are doing what you suggested now, and it renders the Burndown chart a bloody mess. It's not just a workaround, it's a bad hack with nasty side effects.

This also requires users to type in a lot of information, and to do the data input perfectly (as there is no supported method for fixing mistaken input, see GHS-7773). This is a perfect place for very simple automation. This is likely a 15 minute fix on that report.

Expected behavior: If I resolve an issue, the agile burndown chart should consider the issue as having 0 remaining time regardless of the value of its Remaining hours field.
fields.summary: Burndown report includes time remaining from Resolved and Closed issues.

fields.description:
From documentation on creating a board in Greenhopper https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Creating+a+Board : "you will need the JIRA 'Create Shared Objects' global permission before you can create a board. If you don't have this permission you can still create a board, but it will not be visible to other people as its filter will not be shared."

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create 'test' user with group membership of 'jira-users'
# Remove the global permission 'Create Shared Objects' from the group 'jira-users' and assign it to 'jira-developers'
# Go to Agile > Getting Started

Related to this also:
# Go to Agile > Manage Boards
# Click 'Tools' cog and select 'Create board'
# Proceed with either Scrum or Kanban and attempt to create a new board
# Error message "You do not have permission to share. All shares are invalid.". See screenshot.

h3. Expected Results
- The option to create a board would be available

h3. Actual Results
- No option available to create a board
fields.summary: 'Create Shared Objects' global permission required to create rapid boards

fields.description:
Scenario:
Product Owner and team plan using story points, stories on the sprint are then broken into sub-tasks and completed over the sprint.

As a user 
I want to see a burndown by issue count when estimating using Story Points
So that I can avoid having to use time tracking, and have a clearer picture of what my sprint is completing


I would anticipate that the current configuration view for the Estimation tab would allow;

 Estimation Statistic: Story Points
 Time Tracking: Issue Count


Note: "Issue count" means anything that has a JIRA ID and specifically doesn't exclude child types like sub-task.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see a burndown by issue count when my product owner plans with story points

fields.description:
As a Product Owner
I want to speculate improvements in velocity on the version report
So that I can gather some understanding on how changes in velocity impact the projected release dates for my product

I'd like to be able to manipulate the factor used when calculating the optimistic/pessimistic dates, possibly introducing assumed improvements in velocity based on changes in my team dynamics, or recommendations from the team itself.

I'd also like to be able to understand the impact of possible doubling up teams on the project, effectively increasing velocity by say 75% after an initial drop in productive output during team rampup.
fields.summary: As a Product Owner I want to speculate improvements in velocity on the version report

fields.description:
As a product owner
I want to gauge how stale a point estimate is on a story
so I know if the team may need to revisit an old story on the backlog to keep it fresh


h3. Acceptance

 * Can I specify time thresholds to indicate age brackets where a story point estimate is, for instance, "fresh", "stale", "rotten" 
 * Am I shown that a story point is stale within the Planning board?
 * Am I shown that a story point is stale within a ticket view?
 * Am I shown that a story point is stale when exporting tickets from JIRA?
 * Does the age of the story point get updated when the value is changed?
 * Can I "freshen" an existing estimate, without changing its value, to indicate it continues to be correct?
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I want to gauge the staleness of a story point estimate

fields.description: see https://jdog.atlassian.net/browse/JRADEV-20357

fields.description:
If I drag a sprint footer into an upcoming sprint that's below it, as I drag, the subsequent upcoming sprint tally (even though its grayed out) gets updated in realtime. Nice.

If I drag past this sprint further down into the backlog, the backlog tally does not similarly update.
fields.summary: As a user I want the Tally for Backlog to update while dragging a sprint footer into it

fields.description:
I'm dragging the footer of an upcoming sprint down into the backlog to snag some issues for the sprint.

As I drag, the issues pop up into the upcoming sprint panel, but they are missing their bottom edge.

more than a nit, I think the bottom edge helps the behaviour here to be unambiguous.
fields.summary: While dragging sprint,  the bottom edge of a card is not drawn
Sprint story tally badge in sprint footer should have min-width to match badge on card

fields.description:
GreenHopper's Burndown Report has an unfriendly label "Remaining Values". Yeah, they are remaining values in some less than helpful sense. I guess you could call time spent "Values Consumed" as well.

There's a reason you label the legend for values consumed as "Time Spent" -- it's friendly and informative. You also have a configuration value that tells you whether you are tracking remaining time or remaining story points, as you use it to calculate this line. It would be significantly more readable and informative to label this based on the statistic you are calculating, such that the label says "Time Remaining" or "Points Remaining" (or the reversed Remaining Time, etc)
fields.summary: Instead of "Remaining Values", show "Time Remaining" or "Remaining Points" to label the Burndown Report correctly
no tooltip when hover over points on x axis

fields.description: dashed line on the right y axis
fields.summary: Release Date text disappears when the version is released in the future.

fields.summary: Update base URL of help paths to point to 6.2 docs

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. open a GreenHopper Kanban Board;
2. click *Release*;
3. type a name
4. click release.
5. press escape or cancel just after
6. observe the Javascript error

I was reliably reproducing this, but now for some reason cannot. Workaround for now seems to be not to use Firefox when releasing.




{code}
An error occurredHide…

Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details

        Exception: TypeError: this.element is null
        Resource: https://jira.atlassian.com/s/en_UK-ou3pzi-418945332/853/6/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js
        Line: 2543

Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:19.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/19.0
{code}
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=LightGreen} An error is displayed and there's not confirmation for the release, but *the Version is actually released*. After refreshing the screen, Issues from the Done column won't be displayed in the Board anymore. This is only a display error, the functionality itself doesn't seem to be affected.{panel}

(i) If the issues are still appearing, verify that the *Work Sub-Filter* is set to {{fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY}}.
fields.summary: Javascript error on Kanban board when pressing escape while releasing a Version

fields.description: Tested with Chrome on Linux & Mac OS and Firefox on Windows.

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to be able to set a default template for Greenhopper boards, to automatically configure columns and swimlanes.

It would be useful to create a default template so that when simplifying a board, it uses the columns set up on the template (and swimlanes), rather than having to manually set up each one.
fields.summary: Template for JIRA Agile (GreenHopper) boards

fields.description: I need to be able to plan sprints with a multifunctional team and group stories by components within my sprints. Having an easy way to group and filter by component would be very helpful.
fields.summary: As a Project Manager, I'd like to plan sprints by component much like I do for epics, so that I can better manage sprints for a multifunctional team

fields.description:
Currently, the 'Estimate Accuracy' is only available in the Classic Boards.

This would be useful on the Rapid Boards also.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the 'Estimate Accuracy' available on the Rapid Board Burndown chart

fields.description:
Having read GHS-6828 I now understand that we are experiencing the problem we have because we never used the Epic/Theme field due to limitations with it in GreenHopper Classic.  The workaround for that is to first go back and set the Epic/Theme field for all issues that are part of an Epic and then re-start the migration process.

For the sake of this issue that leaves one remaining issue in that once a Sprint is released it is no longer possible to add any of its resolved issues to an Epic.  Just as it may be useful to set a Component on an issue even after the issue is resolved in order to generate more accurate historic statistics it is also desirable to be able to add issues to an Epic after the issue is completed.  Please add the ability to set Epic Links on resolved issues.
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper user, I would like to (bulk) add Epic Links to resolved issues

fields.description:
If a filter is used as the definition of a board, and that filter is deleted, the board is automatically deleted.  There is no warning to the user about such an action being done. 

There is also no way to currently know what filters are being used to as the source for a board. 

We should be either warned or the board not be deleted.  It doesn't contain data or defaults to the project...but, I did not expect the board to be removed.
fields.summary: Deleting a filter associated with a board, deletes a board with no warning

fields.description:
We have been trying to use GreenHopper for our Release plans. In order to effectively take advantage of this, we'd like to set the dates to all our sprints before they actually start.
 
Allowing this would take us off Excel spreadsheets we continue to maintain.
fields.summary: Need to set Sprint dates without 'Starting' the sprint

fields.description:

Please see the screenshot for an example.
